hints.content: Start by thinking about what it means to create consecutive values from the coins. You can always make the value 0 by taking no coins. What is the next value you can make?
Consider the smallest coin in the array. If you have a coin of value 1, you can make every integer value starting from 0. What happens if the smallest coin is greater than 1?
Think about how you can use the coins to build up from 0. If you can make a value `x`, what does that imply about the next values you can create? Can you always make `x + 1`?

As you iterate through the sorted coins, keep track of the maximum consecutive value you can create. If you encounter a coin that is larger than the next value you need to create, you cannot create that value. How would you handle this situation?
Try sorting the coins first. This way, you can process them in increasing order, which helps in determining the maximum consecutive values you can create. What sorting method would you use?

As you iterate through the sorted coins, maintain a variable to track the maximum consecutive value you can create. If the current coin is less than or equal to this maximum value plus one, update your maximum value accordingly. What would your loop look like?
Consider edge cases where all coins are the same or when there are large gaps between coin values. How would these cases affect the maximum consecutive values you can create?

Remember that you can use multiple coins of the same value. This means that if you can create a certain value, you can also create values that are higher by adding more of the same coin. How does this influence your calculations?
Make sure to handle the case where the coins array is empty or contains only one coin. What should your function return in these scenarios?

You are very close to the solution! After sorting the coins and tracking the maximum consecutive value, ensure you return the count of consecutive values starting from 0. What will be your final return statement?

questionNotes: You can make the value 0 by taking no coins.
The smallest coin can significantly influence the range of values you can create.
Sorting the coins helps in processing them in increasing order.
You can use multiple coins of the same value.
Consider edge cases with all coins being the same or large gaps between values.
